We have their default code running and things are mostly working. However, when we drive in a particular direction, I am surprised that the wheels are not all perfectly aligned. By displaying the angle measures on our shuffle board we can tell that some wheels can be as much as 4° away from other wheels. (e.g. 38°, 42°, 220°, 39°)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat is an acceptable degree of tolerance for this? Is improving this just a matter of PID probably not your problem. We found that there was a discrepancy between the physical zero and software zero, but it sounds like you just have an issue with your software zero. This could easily be an issue with PID tolerance, or just PID tuning.
